column4: seems that your pam configuration is broken. when did this happen?
/etc/pam.d/ should contain both su and sudo -files
well, I was emerging various things, and while compiling, I decided to emerge another thing, and it didnt work
then you have broken pam in the process :-)
check for those files first though
what do you mean by 'emerging'?
/etc/pam.d/ contains both su and sudo, what now?
what did you mean by 'emerging'?
I used "emerge glib"
emerge? on ubuntu?
yes, it's possible
and stable
I don't support gentoo, shoo :-)
it's not emerge, it's sudo and su
it's not sudo nor su. your PAM is broken
how do I fix my PAM?
and I've never been able to break it in ubuntu, so it's not an ubuntu problem
try unemerge? ;-)
probably you have overwritten some system criticial files that PAM uses
it's not PAMs problem. it's you and your emerge
just one question, I'm emerging something at the moment while in su, could that be why?
I don't support gentoo
sorry to be anal, but IMHO gentoo users should fix their own problems
